events.message: Applicant has submitted a personal loan application to cover upcoming medical expenses and consolidate existing debt for better financial management.
The loan application was categorised under personal loans due to the purpose including medical bills and debt consolidation.
Loan officer Sarah Jenkins assigned to the case to assist the applicant with any queries and guide through the loan process.
Initial review completed, confirming that the applicant meets basic eligibility criteria for a personal loan, including income verification.
Requested detailed medical bills, proof of income, and recent bank statements to proceed with formal loan assessment.
Applicant submitted all requested documents promptly including hospital bills and updated pay slips for verification.
Credit check completed revealing a satisfactory credit score with some previous timely repayments on credit cards.
Risk assessment evaluated the applicant’s debt-to-income ratio and determined moderate risk due to outstanding debts.
An offer of $15,000 personal loan at 7.5% interest rate for 36 months repayment term has been made to the applicant.
The applicant responded positively to the offer, requesting minor clarifications on prepayment penalties and monthly installments.
Application escalated to senior management for final approval due to the applicant's recent change in employment status.
Senior management approved the loan application after considering all risk factors and positive feedback from the applicant.
Funds totaling $15,000 have been transferred to the applicant’s bank account as per the agreed terms and schedule.
Follow-up call made to the applicant who confirmed receipt of funds and satisfaction with the loan terms and repayment plan.
The personal loan application case has been closed successfully after funding and follow-up confirmation from the applicant.
